Text: Certain powdered baby formulas have been recalled due to contamination with Cronobacter and Salmonella bacteria. Make sure that your formula is safe to use and learn more about recalled products here: https://t.co/mPboGSXe3u

While Putin begins his plans to invade Ukraine, the US cannot sit by and allow large autocrats to invade their neighbors and infringe on international sovereignty. I am glad to see @POTUS has begun to put sanctions in place to show Putin the consequences of his actions.

On March 27, 1968, MLK spoke about the need for economic justice and a fair minimum wage. The Jersey Journal remarked at the time that the speech unified the community. Learn more about the speech and how it affected those who were there: https://t.co/AHbAqhxwZ5

#BlackHistoryMonth is a chance for continual learning about history and its impact on our community. Did you know that Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. delivered one of his last speeches at the Metropolitan A.M.E. Zion church in Jersey City? https://t.co/ycKNlEIPNB

Title 42 has been used to expel vulnerable people, including thousands of Black migrants, who could face harm in their home countries. I signed onto a bicameral letter to @POTUS urging him to end the use of Title 42 and uphold our obligation to safeguard the right to seek asylum.

Abolitionists fought to support those escaping slavery, although much of the community opposed the abolition movement. Before the Civil War, an estimated 50,000-70,000 enslaved persons passed through Jersey City to freedom. Read more: https://t.co/8NGqgsrPl3

#BlackHistoryMonth gives us all an opportunity to learn more about how our community connects to importance pieces of black history. In fact, Jersey City was the last stop on the Underground Railroad for those escaping slavery in other states.

Today is also National Donor Day, a day to donate blood, marrow, and other tissues. I am so thankful for the kind-hearted, giving people who donate these lifesaving materials. Find a blood drive or donation center here: https://t.co/vz9YIIB9pc
Happy Valentine's Day to New Jersey‚Äôs 8th District! ‚ù§Ô∏è
Congrats to @rasjbaraka on the City of Newark‚Äôs successful Lead Line Replacement program, which replaced the city‚Äôs lead service lines in under three years w/o charging residents a dime.
Free, at-home COVID-19 tests are available for every household. Call the help line if you need any assistance. https://t.co/lnlGlhveEo

The USPS provides an essential service for millions of New Jerseyans delivering billions of pieces of mail a year. This week, the House passed the Postal Service Reform Act to keep the post office running sustainably, improve transparency, and increase on-time deliveries.

During American Heart Month, we raise awareness of the impact of heart disease. Heart disease is the leading cause of death in the US and has an equal impact on men and women. Learn more about being heart healthy at https://t.co/RN5PxccDQR. https://t.co/BBICf8rwsy

National Black HIV/AIDS Awareness Day is a day to highlight the progress made in fighting the HIV & raise awareness on how we #StopHIVTogether. We must continue to break down barriers to testing, prevention & treatment, & ensure access to culturally competent care without stigma.

Last week, the House voted to invest in the future of our economy, supply chain resiliency, and advancements in the fields of science and technology by passing the COMPETES Act. Just as with the American Rescue Plan, when we invest in the American people, we grow our economy.

This week is Gun Violence Survivor‚Äôs Week, a time to reckon with the gun violence crisis & take action to prevent further violence. I urge the Senate to pass the background check bills already passed by the House which would be a first, & necessary, step to improving gun safety.

As Chairman of the Subcommittee on the Western Hemisphere, I am working to hold dictators accountable in Nicaragua, Venezuela, & Cuba, combat corruption & strengthen rule of law in Guatemala & Honduras, & advocate for increased vaccine distribution & deepened economic engagement.

This is a challenging moment for Latin American & the Caribbean, with the highest levels of poverty seen in almost 3 decades, school disruptions threatening reading proficiency for millions of children, and growing threats to democratic institutions.

@HouseForeign The upcoming Summit of the Americas provides an opportunity for the US to demonstrate our commitment to working with our Latin American and Caribbean partners to rebuild their economies and strengthen their democracies.
Today, @HouseForeign discussed US priorities in the Western Hemisphere, a region that was particularly hard-hit by the pandemic.

This month, we honor and celebrate the accomplishments of Black Americans. We take this time to reflect on Black history, appreciate the impact of historical Black leaders, and focus our efforts on making this a more just and equitable nation. #BlackHistoryMonth https://t.co/X4gtyXcfUT
Happy Lunar New Year to all those celebrating in #NJ08 and around the world! Wishing you all a happy year of the Tiger.

On this day in 1940, the first Social Security check was issued. In the last 82 years, Social Security has bolstered financial stability, provided additional family income, and stimulated the nation‚Äôs economy.
I reiterate my longstanding demand for the immediate release of all Cubans jailed for speaking out against the regime. The world must not ignore these injustices. #JailedForWhat

The Diaz-Canel regime is prosecuting more than 700 Cubans, including 55 children, for exercising their most basic rights and participating in the July protests. These sham trials are the latest attempt to maintain authoritarian control of the Cuban people.https://t.co/msJgClXHpj

I know that it is hard to see this economic improvement at the gas pump or grocery store. The truth is inflation is a concern. However, the Fed plans to deploy monetary tools to rein in prices, which will further help recover from the economic upheaval of the pandemic.

This rapid improvement is a result of the American Rescue Plan, which included measures to support families with an expanded Child Tax Credit, invest in pandemic response & vaccination, and stimulate the economy. By investing in the American people, we grew our economy.

@JC_Econ, a former Fed economist says: ‚ÄúFiscal and monetary policy committed to supporting the economy aggressively during the pandemic, and it worked. Not only did we meet the goal of shortening the recession, we exceeded all expectations.‚Äù

Our economy is getting back on track with remarkable speed. Last year ended strong with an economic expansion of 5.7%, the largest since 1984.
https://t.co/Gz1YYb4C7f

During National Birth Defects Prevention Month, learn more about birth defect prevention, health of infants with birth defects, and lifelong health here: https://t.co/Pm4W56IQ0i

The CDC now recommends wearing the most protective, well-fitted masks. These masks filter virus particles from the air much better than cloth masks. 
@POTUS is making N95s more available by distributing 400 million masks to pharmacies and health care centers beginning next week.

January is Glaucoma Awareness Month. Glaucoma has no early symptoms, so many people don‚Äôt know they have it. However, early treatment can prevent further eye damage. Learn more about glaucoma and if you should get tested: https://t.co/EPAjQWfi7l

With trusted partners like these, we can counter authoritarianism and create a freer, more prosperous future for the hemisphere based on our interdependence and shared values. See my full statement here: https://t.co/Y69zG5aE6O

As the region grapples with democratic backsliding and some of its gravest human rights challenges in decades, this alliance provides an example of what the US Govt should be trying to elevate diplomatically and economically.

Today, I held a hearing on the new alliance between Costa Rica, Panama, and the Dominican Republic. All three countries are key U.S. allies that are working to advance democracy, economic opportunity, and regional cooperation.
During my final year in Congress, I will continue working with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to deliver on important legislative priorities that will benefit the American people.

We also passed the bipartisan Infrastructure Investment and Jobs Act, a long overdue and historic investment in the nation‚Äôs infrastructure which will make necessary repairs and ensure that our infrastructure is resilient to extreme weather.

@HouseDems have delivered on our promises by passing the American Rescue Plan to provide much needed relief to American families by expanding the Child Tax Credit, fund COVID-19 testing and vaccination programs, help schools reopen, and reinvigorate the economy.

President Biden ushered in a more diverse administration, which prioritized delivering vaccines PPE, and tests, greatly reduced childhood poverty, added 6 million jobs, and continues to strive to deliver on its campaign promises.

A year ago today, when @POTUS was inaugurated, the nation was more divided than ever before. While many challenges persist, President Biden has given us the opportunity to heal from years of divisive rhetoric, confront the pandemic, and invest in the American people.

During Cervical Health Awareness Month, we raise awareness of cervical cancer, a highly preventable and treatable cancer. Learn more about regular screening for early detection of cervical cancer: https://t.co/75nxbzMmm5

COVID-19 tests are now more easily available to all Americans. These tests will arrive typically within 7-12 days, so order ahead and consider other testing resources if you need to test immediately.

Today we honor Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., a transformational¬†and inspirational leader for generations of Americans. His memory is often invoked when we hold our nation up to its founding ideals that all men are created equal.

While women in New Jersey now have their right to abortion care codified into law, that right is being violated in many states across the country. I urge the Senate to pass the Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act now to enshrine into law a woman‚Äôs right to choose.

Today, @GovMurphy signed legislation which codifies a woman‚Äôs right to choose and expands access to reproductive health care throughout New Jersey. With abortion rights under attack, this law is more important than ever to protect women‚Äôs health in New Jersey.

In a democracy, it should be common sense that Americans should have equal access to the ballot. Today, I was proud to vote in favor of the Freedom to Vote: John R. Lewis Act to protect the sacred right to vote. Please see my statement: https://t.co/5jX6jsx7Nr

January is National Blood Donor Month, and a time when blood donations are usually in short supply. This year, the Red Cross warns that there is a blood supply shortage which may impact patient care. If you can donate this lifesaving resource, please see: https://t.co/8ijWQZIjwl
For information about COVID-19 testing locations and free at-home tests, please see: https://t.co/7Z6NCqGsqK

If you have already received your COVID-19 vaccine, schedule an appointment for a booster for additional protection against the Omicron variant. For those who remain unvaccinated, please consult a health care provider about your questions.

Vaccination is vital to reducing COVID-19 related deaths and the surge in hospitalizations which puts an increasing strain on our hospital systems and health care workers. New Jersey has made remarkable progress on vaccinations, with 71% of the state vaccinated.

COVID-19 cases are surging in New Jersey, and across the country, due to the highly infectious Omicron variant. Although it is possible to get infected even after full vaccination, COVID-19 vaccines are highly effective at preventing severe illness.

@HouseDems These bills would work in tandem, with the Freedom to Vote Act responding to current threats to our democracy, and the John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Act preventing states from enacting discriminatory voting laws going forward. I urge the Senate to pass both bills.

This bill, which @HouseDems passed, would prevent states from enacting laws which are designed to make it harder to vote for people of color. It is time for the Senate to advance H.R. 4 to restore protections for the right to vote.

The John R. Lewis Voting Advancement Rights Act restores the requirement that states with a history of racial discrimination in voting receive approval from the DOJ in order to make changes to voting systems.

The Freedom to Vote Act includes similar provisions to H.R. 1, the For the People Act, which I cosponsored and voted for when it passed the House in March 2021. Unfortunately, this important voting rights legislation has stalled in the Senate.

The Freedom to Vote Act, led by @SenAmyKlobuchar, sets nationwide standards to protect American‚Äôs vote. It would:
‚úÖExpand automatic voter registration
‚úÖMake Election Day a holiday
‚úÖStrengthen vote-by-mail and early voting
‚úÖPrevent election subversion 
‚úÖ& other reforms

The anniversary of Jan. 6 reminds us of the danger that our democracy faces and its vulnerability to election subversion. It is time to pass the Freedom to Vote Act and the John Lewis Voting Rights Act to protect our democracy and the sacred right to vote.

The Ortega dictatorship is currently holding over 170 political prisoners, including Ana Margarita Vigil, who was abused by regime officials and held in isolation. Each of them must be released immediately.

It‚Äôs a dark day in #Nicaragua, as Daniel Ortega will name himself king after he was too afraid to hold an election in November. It‚Äôs not an election when you imprison every person who tried to run against you.

Es un d√≠a oscuro en #Nicaragua, ya que Daniel Ortega se ha nombrado el rey del pa√≠s despu√©s de negar elecciones leg√≠timas en noviembre. No es una elecci√≥n cuando decides encarcelar a todos los que intentan competir.

I fully support the Biden administration‚Äôs continued commitment to sanctioning Cuban officials who violate human rights. More than 700 Cubans are still arbitrarily detained for peacefully protesting; they must all be released. https://t.co/EAsk8pVoyz
Merry Christmas to all those celebrating in the Coptic Christian community. Wishing you all a happy and healthy celebration.

Full, accurate knowledge of the Capitol attack is needed in order to better protect our democracy and for future generations to understand our history. For that reason, I want to share my story of that day. Please see my statement: https://t.co/JxJfzf576f

As a nation, we must have a full understanding of what happened on Jan. 6. I continue to support the work of the @January6thCmte to provide the American people with a comprehensive understanding of what happened that day and why it presents a grave threat to our democracy.

The experience of a violent attempt to overthrow democratic institutions brought back intense memories of my childhood in Cuba. It was a terrifying moment that I never imagined would happen in the country that took my family in when we fled a violent dictatorship.

A year ago today, our democracy was attacked by a violent mob inspired by the former President and his lies about the 2020 election. The former President has had an entire year to take responsibility for his actions, yet he has chosen to continue to lie to his supporters.

Happy New Year! 2021 was another difficult year due to the ongoing challenges of the pandemic, although we made significant progress thanks to the vaccine. In 2022, we have an opportunity to truly overcome these challenges. Wishing everyone happiness and health in the new year.
@GovMurphy recently announced the availability of free, at-home PCR tests. For information on these at-home tests, as well as free, in-person testing locations, please visit: https://t.co/rhnEIrVrIe

COVID-19 cases are rising again in New Jersey. We now know that the best protection is to get vaccinated and receive a booster dose. Ask a healthcare provider if you have questions, and see guidance from the CDC here: https://t.co/dvcEGK9KLw
Merry Christmas to all those who celebrate in New Jersey‚Äôs 8th District and across the country. I hope that you are able to be safely surrounded by family and loved ones during the holiday season.

@POTUS announced that the pause on student loan payments will extend until May 1, 2022, as many still continue to struggle due to the pandemic. While this is not a permanent solution, this is good news for 41 million borrowers across the country.

While my time in Congress will come to an end, my commitment to service remains as strong as ever. I will continue to fight for policies that will improve the lives of New Jerseyans and I look forward to remaining active in Hudson County, especially my hometown of West New York.
I have made the difficult decision to not seek reelection in 2022 and retire at the end of the 117th Congress. See my full statement: https://t.co/HOhbRaBfDg

Nearly 1 in 3 roadway fatalities occur in impaired driving crashes. National Impaired Driving Prevention Month is a time to raise awareness of the continued threat of impaired drivers. Thanks to ride sharing & taxis, there is never a reason to get behind the wheel impaired.

December is Safe Toys and Gifts Month. The US has stringent regulations to ensure that toys are safe. However, with the Holidays just around the corner, keep these safety tips in mind: https://t.co/NGsA1DdMOy.

2 million Americans lack health insurance because their state chose not to expand Medicaid eligibility under the ACA. Build Back Better makes more historic investments in health by increasing tax credits for Americans caught in the ‚ÄòMedicaid Coverage Gap.‚Äô

The Build Back Better Act reduces health care premiums for the 31 million of Americans who get their health coverage through the Affordable Care Act Marketplace, providing insurance coverage to an estimated 3 million additional people.

1 in 5 Medicare recipients struggle to pay for their medicine. #BuildBackBetter would allow Medicare to negotiate drug prices, a long-awaited reform that will save seniors thousands in prescription drug prices each year. It also adds comprehensive hearing benefits to Medicare.

The Build Back Better Act, which the House passed last month, includes a number of health care provisions that will reduce the cost of care and medications, and expand coverage to millions of Americans.

Thank you to everyone who participated in this year‚Äôs Congressional App Challenge. I was truly impressed by the talent of students across #NJ8 and I believe that your computer science skills and creativity will take you far.

I‚Äôm proud to announce that #NJ8‚Äôs first place winner is Ashton Tang for his app, ‚ÄúSmart Food Rescue Inventory Management.‚Äù Ashton was inspired by his time volunteering to create an app which would help efficiently and equitably deliver food to homeless shelters.

Our 2nd place winners are Harita and Sharada Suresh for their app, ‚ÄúMy SHERO.‚Äù The sisters created this app to honor and share the stories of female historical figures, recognizing the importance of representation of female role models. https://t.co/e7ractxPvU

This year‚Äôs third place winner is Ashita Burla for her app, ‚ÄúCombatting COVID-19.‚Äù This app would help patients and doctors communicate COVID-19 test results and provides resources to improve mental health during the pandemic. https://t.co/fCOZm9PbT9

I am proud to announce this year‚Äôs Congressional App Challenge winners in New Jersey‚Äôs 8th District. 

The #CongressionalAppChallenge is an annual coding competition in which middle school and high school students compete to design & code a creative app to help their community.

As a nation, we must have a full understanding of what happened on and before Jan. 6, especially as some try to spin another narrative for their benefit. It is important for future generations to accurately understand our history, and for us to protect our democracy now.

To be clear, the purpose of this committee is to investigate the full extent of the crimes committed on and before Jan. 6, to create a historical record of those events, and to prevent a future assault on the Capitol, and on our democracy.

Last night, I joined my colleagues to recommend holding Mark Meadows in contempt of Congress for refusing to comply with a subpoena from the Jan. 6 Committee. Meadows, and others, who choose to withhold information about Jan. 6 are failing to uphold their duty to the country.

#BuildBackBetter would provide essential support to American workers. It would
‚úÖEstablish a paid leave program for family and medical leave 
‚úÖExtend the expanded Earned Income Tax Credit for 17 million low-wage workers
‚úÖTriple the credit for childless workers.

Today is #UNHumanRightsDay, the 73rd anniversary of the UN‚Äôs adoption of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. On this day, we reaffirm our commitment to human rights at home and abroad and honor activists around the world who strive to guarantee fundamental freedoms.
Ortega‚Äôs goal is to stay in power at any cost and he figures he will need authoritarian allies to do so. Taiwan obviously does not fit the bill.
It‚Äôs disappointing but unsurprising that the Ortega regime has decided to abandon Taiwan at a time when it has also abandoned any semblance of democratic legitimacy. https://t.co/9OZrbKLgSu

This historic legislation also makes major investments in affordable housing to support the rehabilitation and improvement of more than 1 million affordable homes, boosting housing supply and reducing price pressures for renters and homeowners.

#BuildBackBetter will expand rental housing vouchers to families in need and enable hundreds of thousands of first-generation homebuyers to buy their first home by investing in down payment assistance. It will enable more families to reside in higher opportunity neighborhoods.
The Build Back Better Act, which passed the House last month, will make a major impact on those across the country who are in need of reliable housing.

See my full op-ed on what Congress must do to address the climate crisis: https://t.co/JiLAmPGzHj.

Refusing to take action on the climate crisis is dangerous, will cost trillions in storm damages, and will only cause the crisis to worsen. We must act now to transition to clean energy, reduce pollution, improve climate resiliency, and conserve public land & water from drilling.

Hurricane Ida is just a recent example of an extreme weather event which sent devastating flooding and winds to communities like mine. But these events are becoming more frequent in New Jersey and across the country.

On the 80th anniversary of the attack on #PearlHarbor, our country honors the American soldiers that lost their lives on that infamous day. Their sacrifices will never be forgotten as we remember all those who fought to keep our nation free from tyranny during WWII.

If you aren‚Äôt already vaccinated, now is the time to schedule your shot. If you‚Äôre vaccinated, but haven‚Äôt had your booster, now is the time to schedule your shot. If you have questions about vaccines, ask a healthcare provider.

On December 1, 1955, Rosa Parks was arrested for refusing to conform to unjust segregation laws, sparking the Montgomery Bus Boycott and inspiring other civil rights activists. On #RosaParksDay we honor her activism & integrity in the fight for equality.

Throughout my time in Congress, I have advocated for funding for the @CDCgov's HIV/AIDS programs and for an end to the stigma against those with the virus. We must continue to increase awareness of individual risk factors and prevention in order to put an end to the HIV pandemic.

Today is World AIDS Day, a day for people to unite in the fight against HIV/AIDS. Since its discovery in 1984, there have been many scientific advances in understanding, treating, and preventing HIV, including the development of PrEP.
By passing the Women‚Äôs Health Protection Act, @HouseDems are fighting to federally codify Roe. I urge the Senate to swiftly pass WHPA to safeguard a woman‚Äôs right to a safe and legal abortion.

Abortion restrictions disproportionately affect those who already face barriers accessing health care, especially women of color and low-income women. We have already seen the effects of Texas‚Äô recent anti-abortion law, which has forced women to travel out of state to seek care.

The Court‚Äôs decision will impact millions of women‚Äôs lives across the country, as it decides whether or not states can dismantle rights to bodily autonomy and health care access. If the Mississippi law is upheld, it is likely that other states will follow suit.

Jackson Women‚Äôs Health is the last abortion clinic in Mississippi, due to years of pressure on women's health providers from the state legislature. Like other states, Mississippi imposed anti-choice laws on providers w/ the intent of closing off women‚Äôs access to health services.
Today, @SCOTUS hears oral arguments for Dobbs v. Jackson Women‚Äôs Health Organization, the most consequential abortion rights case in decades.

These investments will finally take action to help close the racial wealth gap by making college education more affordable for everyone and begin to even the playing field for minority serving institutions.

Build Back Better also provides historic investments HBCUs, Tribal Colleges and Universities, and minority-serving institutions to modernize research facilities, school infrastructure, and expanded financial aid to low-income students.

Millions of college students across the country are struggling to afford the rising cost of education. #BuildBackBetter will make college more affordable by increasing Pell Grant awards by $550 and expanding access to DREAMers.

@HouseDemocrats We will not stop fighting for working class families as we work to enact this vital legislation.

@HouseDemocrats fought for each of these provisions in order to help families recover from the economic impacts of the pandemic. #BuildBackBetter is a solution to many of the country‚Äôs longstanding issues which have caused a strain for too many Americans.

Build Back Better also makes historic investments in food assistance, investing $10 billion to expand eligibility for children to receive free school meals and fund a nationwide program to provide healthy meals to children over the summer and when school is not in session.

By establishing universal free pre-k for over 6 million children, Build Back Better enables parents to send their children to a school of their choice. Ensuring that children can go to pre-k not only helps parents ease back into the workplace but supports kids‚Äô future learning.

The Child Tax Credit has already made a significant difference for millions of families by providing financial stability and reducing child poverty. #BuildBackBetter continues this progress by extending the CTC through 2022.

The Build Back Better Act, which passed in the House last week, will help families in #NJ8 and across the country afford daily expenses, access quality education, and have reliable access to healthy meals.

November is Military Family Appreciation Month, a time to recognize the family members of our nation‚Äôs servicemembers. To all military families, thank you for the sacrifices you have made to support your loved ones in their brave service to the nation.

The Build Back Better Act is now under consideration in the Senate. I urge my Senate colleagues to swiftly pass this transformational piece of legislation.

Build Back Better will now be considered by the Senate. I urge my Senate colleagues to quickly take up and pass this historic piece of legislation.

@HouseDems fought to pass #BuildBackBetter to support all Americans and invest in future generations by increasing access to high quality education, ensuring that families have the means to support and feed their children, and combatting the worsening climate crisis.

This hard-fought legislation responds to Americans needs, especially those issues worsened by the pandemic. Through Build Back Better, we will support economic growth by investing in the American people‚Äôs ability to afford their basic needs like health care, childcare, & housing.
